qas.question: Who did Apple partner with to monitor its labor policies?
What organization did Apple join to monitor its labor policies?

answers.text: Electronic Industry Code of Conduct Implementation Group

qas.question: What company was found to be violating Apple's labor policies?
Where was the Foxconn plant located?
What was the name of Apple's manufacturing company that was accused of overworking its employees?
What auditor company did Apple hire to oversee worker conditions following the controversy?
In what year did Foxconn workers first unionize?

context: <a2_0><a4_0>Foxconn<a4_0/><a2_0/>, Apple's manufacturer, initially denied the abuses, but when an auditing team from Apple found that workers had been working longer hours than were allowed under Chinese law, they promised to prevent workers working more hours than the code allowed. Apple hired a workplace standards auditing company, <a0_0><a5_0>Verité<a5_0/><a0_0/>, and joined the <a1_0>Electronic Industry Code of Conduct Implementation Group<a1_0/> to oversee the measures. On December 31, <a6_0>2006<a6_0/>, workers at the Foxconn factory in <a3_0>Longhua, Shenzhen<a3_0/> formed a union affiliated with the All-China Federation of Trade Unions, the Chinese government-approved union umbrella organization.
